doc.after: Early in Lenny's duration, a tropical storm warning and hurricane watch were issued for Jamaica. Later, a hurricane watch was issued for the southern coast of Hispaniola, and a tropical storm warning was also issued for the Dominican Republic.[1] Haitian officials declared a state of alert in three southern provinces and allocated about $1Â million (1999Â USD) in hurricane funds.[18] Residents in flood-prone areas were advised to evacuate in southern Haiti and in the neighboring Dominican Republic.[19][20]
